refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Functionality for manipulating basic metadata for files. GFileInfo implements methods for getting information that all files should contain, and allows for manipulation of extended attributes.
See GFileAttribute for more information on how GIO handles file attributes.

To obtain a GFileInfo for a GFile, use g_file_query_info() (or its async variant). To obtain a GFileInfo for a file input or output stream, use g_file_input_stream_query_info() or g_file_output_stream_query_info() (or their async variants).
To change the actual attributes of a file, you should then set the attribute in the GFileInfo and call g_file_set_attributes_from_info() or g_file_set_attributes_async() on a GFile.

However, not all attributes can be changed in the file. For instance, the actual size of a file cannot be changed via g_file_info_set_size(). You may call g_file_query_settable_attributes() and g_file_query_writable_namespaces() to discover the settable attributes of a particular file at runtime.
GFileAttributeMatcher allows for searching through a GFileInfo for attributes.

refsect2.title: GFileAttributeMatcher
refsect2.para: Determines if a string matches a file attribute.

refsect2.title: enum GFileType
refsect2.para: Indicates the file's on-disk type.

listitem.simpara: File handle represents a regular file.
File handle represents a symbolic link (Unix systems).
File is a "special" file, such as a socket, fifo, block device, or character device.

refsect2.title: GFileInfo
refsect2.para: Stores information about a file system object referenced by a GFile.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_TYPE
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for storing file types. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32. The value for this key should contain a GFileType.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_IS_HIDDEN
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for checking if a file is hidden. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_IS_BACKUP
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for checking if a file is a backup file. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_IS_SYMLINK
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for checking if the file is a symlink. Typically the actual type is something else, if we followed the symlink to get the type. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_IS_VIRTUAL
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for checking if a file is virtual. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_NAME
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the name of the file. The name is the on-disk filename which may not be in any known encoding, and can thus not be generally displayed as is. Use G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_DISPLAY_NAME if you need to display the name in a user interface. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BYTE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_DISPLAY_NAME
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the display name of the file. A display name is guaranteed to be in UTF8 and can thus be displayed in the UI. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_EDIT_NAME
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for edit name of the file. An edit name is similar to the display name, but it is meant to be used when you want to rename the file in the UI. The display name might contain information you don't want in the new filename (such as "(invalid unicode)" if the filename was in an invalid encoding).
Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_COPY_NAME
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the copy name of the file. The copy name is an optional version of the name. If availible its always in UTF8, and corresponds directly to the original filename (only transcoded to UTF8). This is useful if you want to copy the file to another filesystem that might have a different encoding. If the filename is not a valid string in the encoding selected for the filesystem it is in then the copy name will not be set.
Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_ICON
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the icon for the file. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_OBJECT. The value for this key should contain a GIcon.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_CONTENT_TYPE
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the content type of the file. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING. The value for this key should contain a valid content type.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_FAST_CONTENT_TYPE
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the fast content type. The fast content type isn't as reliable as the regular one, as it only uses the filename to guess it, but it is faster to calculate than the regular content type. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_SIZE
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the file's size (in bytes). Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_SYMLINK_TARGET
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the symlink target, if the file is a symlink. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BYTE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_TARGET_URI
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the target URI for the file, in the case of G_FILE_TYPE_SHORTCUT or G_FILE_TYPE_MOUNTABLE files. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_SORT_ORDER
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for setting the sort order of a file. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_INT32. An example use would be in file managers, which would use this key to set the order files are displayed. Files with smaller sort order should be sorted first, and files without sort order as if sort order was zero.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ETAG_VALUE
refsect2.para: A key in the "etag" namespace for getting the value of the file's entity tag. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ID_FILE
refsect2.para: A key in the "id" namespace for getting a file identifier. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING. An example use would be during listing files, to avoid recursive directory scanning.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ID_FILESYSTEM
refsect2.para: A key in the "id" namespace for getting the file system identifier. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING. An example use would be during drag and drop to see if the source and target are on the same filesystem (default to move) or not (default to copy).

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ACCESS_CAN_READ
refsect2.para: A key in the "access" namespace for getting read privileges. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN. This attribute will be TRUE if the user is able to read the file.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ACCESS_CAN_WRITE
refsect2.para: A key in the "access" namespace for getting write privileges. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN. This attribute will be TRUE if the user is able to write to the file.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ACCESS_CAN_EXECUTE
refsect2.para: A key in the "access" namespace for getting execution privileges. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN. This attribute will be TRUE if the user is able to execute the file.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ACCESS_CAN_DELETE
refsect2.para: A key in the "access" namespace for checking deletion privileges. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN. This attribute will be TRUE if the user is able to delete the file.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ACCESS_CAN_TRASH
refsect2.para: A key in the "access" namespace for checking trashing privileges. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN. This attribute will be TRUE if the user is able to move the file to the trash.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ACCESS_CAN_RENAME
refsect2.para: A key in the "access" namespace for checking renaming privileges. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN. This attribute will be TRUE if the user is able to rename the file.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_MOUNTABLE_CAN_MOUNT
refsect2.para: A key in the "mountable" namespace for checking if a file (of type G_FILE_TYPE_MOUNTABLE) is mountable. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_MOUNTABLE_CAN_UNMOUNT
refsect2.para: A key in the "mountable" namespace for checking if a file (of type G_FILE_TYPE_MOUNTABLE) is unmountable. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_MOUNTABLE_CAN_EJECT
refsect2.para: A key in the "mountable" namespace for checking if a file (of type G_FILE_TYPE_MOUNTABLE) can be ejected. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_MOUNTABLE_UNIX_DEVICE
refsect2.para: A key in the "mountable" namespace for getting the unix device. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_MOUNTABLE_HAL_UDI
refsect2.para: A key in the "mountable" namespace for getting the HAL UDI for the mountable file. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_MODIFIED
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the time the file was last modified. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64, and contains the UNIX time since the file was modified.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_MODIFIED_USEC
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the miliseconds of the time the file was last modified. This should be used in conjunction with G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_MODIFIED. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_ACCESS
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the time the file was last accessed. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64, and contains the UNIX time since the file was last accessed.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_ACCESS_USEC
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the microseconds of the time the file was last accessed. This should be used in conjunction with G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_ACCESS. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_CHANGED
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the time the file was last changed. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64, and contains the UNIX time since the file was last changed.
This corresponds to the traditional UNIX ctime.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_CHANGED_USEC
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the microseconds of the time the file was last changed. This should be used in conjunction with G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_CHANGED. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_CREATED
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the time the file was created. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64, and contains the UNIX time since the file was created.
This corresponds to the NTFS ctime.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_CREATED_USEC
refsect2.para: A key in the "time" namespace for getting the microseconds of the time the file was created. This should be used in conjunction with G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_CREATED. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_DEVICE
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the device id of the device the file is located on (see stat() documentation). This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_INODE
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the inode of the file. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_MODE
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the mode of the file (e.g. whether the file is a regular file, symlink, etc). See lstat() documentation. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_NLINK
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the number of hard links for a file. See lstat() documentation. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_UID
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the user ID for the file. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_GID
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the group ID for the file. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_RDEV
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the device ID for the file (if it is a special file). See lstat() documentation. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_BLOCK_SIZE
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the block size for the file system. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_BLOCKS
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for getting the number of blocks allocated for the file. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_UNIX_IS_MOUNTPOINT
refsect2.para: A key in the "unix" namespace for checking if the file represents a UNIX mount point. This attribute is TRUE if the file is a UNIX mount point. This attribute is only available for UNIX file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DOS_IS_ARCHIVE
refsect2.para: A key in the "dos" namespace for checking if the file's archive flag is set. This attribute is TRUE if the archive flag is set. This attribute is only available for DOS file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DOS_IS_SYSTEM
refsect2.para: A key in the "dos" namespace for checking if the file's backup flag is set. This attribute is TRUE if the backup flag is set. This attribute is only available for DOS file systems. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OWNER_USER
refsect2.para: A key in the "owner" namespace for getting the user name of the file's owner. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OWNER_USER_REAL
refsect2.para: A key in the "owner" namespace for getting the real name of the user that owns the file. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OWNER_GROUP
refsect2.para: A key in the "owner" namespace for getting the file owner's group. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_THUMBNAIL_PATH
refsect2.para: A key in the "thumbnail" namespace for getting the path to the thumbnail image. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BYTE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_THUMBNAILING_FAILED
refsect2.para: A key in the "thumbnail" namespace for checking if thumbnailing failed. This attribute is TRUE if thumbnailing failed. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_FILESYSTEM_SIZE
refsect2.para: A key in the "filesystem" namespace for getting the total size (in bytes) of the file system, used in g_file_query_filesystem_info(). Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_FILESYSTEM_FREE
refsect2.para: A key in the "filesystem" namespace for getting the number of bytes of free space left on the file system. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT64.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_FILESYSTEM_TYPE
refsect2.para: A key in the "filesystem" namespace for getting the file system's type. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_FILESYSTEM_READONLY
refsect2.para: A key in the "filesystem" namespace for checking if the file system is read only. Is set to TRUE if the file system is read only. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_GVFS_BACKEND
refsect2.para: A key in the "gvfs" namespace that gets the name of the current GVFS backend in use. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SELINUX_CONTEXT
refsect2.para: A key in the "selinux" namespace for getting the file's SELinux context. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING. Note that this attribute is only available if GLib has been built with SELinux support.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TRASH_ITEM_COUNT
refsect2.para: A key in the "trash" namespace. When requested against "trash:///" returns the number of (toplevel) items in the trash folder. Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UINT32.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_FILESYSTEM_USE_PREVIEW
refsect2.para: A key in the "filesystem" namespace for hinting a file manager application whether it should preview (e.g. thumbnail) files on the file system. The value for this key contain a GFilesystemPreviewType.

refsect2.title: G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_DESCRIPTION
refsect2.para: A key in the "standard" namespace for getting the description of the file. The description is a utf8 string that describes the file, generally containing the filename, but can also contain furter information. Example descriptions could be "filename (on hostname)" for a remote file or "filename (in trash)" for a file in the trash. This is useful for instance as the window title when displaying a directory or for a bookmarks menu.
Corresponding GFileAttributeType is G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new file info structure.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_dup ()
refsect2.para: Duplicates a file info structure.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_copy_into ()
refsect2.para: Copies all of the GFileAttributes from src_info to dest_info.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_has_attribute ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a file info structure has an attribute named attribute.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if Ginfo has an attribute named attribute, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_list_attributes ()
refsect2.para: Lists the file info structure's attributes.

listitem.simpara: a null-terminated array of strings of all of the possible attribute types for the given name_space, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the attribute type for an attribute key.

listitem.simpara: a GFileAttributeType for the given attribute, or G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_INVALID if the key is invalid.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_remove_attribute ()
refsect2.para: Removes all cases of attribute from info if it exists.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_as_string ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of a attribute, formated as a string. This escapes things as needed to make the string valid utf8.

listitem.simpara: a UTF-8 string associated with the given attribute. When you're done with the string it must be freed with g_free().

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_file_info_get_attribute_data (GFileInfo *info, const char *attribute, GFileAttributeType *type, gpointer *value_pp, GFileAttributeStatus *status);
refsect2.para: Gets the attribute type, value and status for an attribute key.

listitem.simpara: return location for the attribute type, or NULL
return location for the attribute value, or NULL
return location for the attribute status, or NULL
TRUE if info has an attribute named attribute, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_status ()
refsect2.para: Gets the attribute status for an attribute key.

listitem.simpara: a GFileAttributeStatus for the given attribute, or G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STATUS_UNSET if the key is invalid.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_string ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of a string attribute. If the attribute does not contain a string, NULL will be returned.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the attribute value as a string, or NULL otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_byte_string ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of a byte string attribute. If the attribute does not contain a byte string, NULL will be returned.

listitem.simpara: the contents of the attribute value as a byte string, or NULL otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of a boolean attribute. If the attribute does not contain a boolean value, FALSE will be returned.

listitem.simpara: the boolean value contained within the attribute.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_uint32 ()
refsect2.para: Gets an unsigned 32-bit integer contained within the attribute. If the attribute does not contain an unsigned 32-bit integer, or is invalid, 0 will be returned.

listitem.simpara: an unsigned 32-bit integer from the attribute.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_int32 ()
refsect2.para: Gets a signed 32-bit integer contained within the attribute. If the attribute does not contain a signed 32-bit integer, or is invalid, 0 will be returned.

listitem.simpara: a signed 32-bit integer from the attribute.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_uint64 ()
refsect2.para: Gets a unsigned 64-bit integer contained within the attribute. If the attribute does not contain an unsigned 64-bit integer, or is invalid, 0 will be returned.

listitem.simpara: a unsigned 64-bit integer from the attribute.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_int64 ()
refsect2.para: Gets a signed 64-bit integer contained within the attribute. If the attribute does not contain an signed 64-bit integer, or is invalid, 0 will be returned.

listitem.simpara: a signed 64-bit integer from the attribute.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_attribute_object ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of a GObject attribute. If the attribute does not contain a GObject, NULL will be returned.

listitem.simpara: a GObject associated with the given attribute, or NULL otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_file_info_set_attribute (GFileInfo *info, const char *attribute, GFileAttributeType type, gpointer value_p);
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_string ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_byte_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_file_info_set_attribute_byte_string (GFileInfo *info, const char *attribute, const char *attr_value);
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_uint32 ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_int32 ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_uint64 ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_int64 ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

listitem.simpara: int64 value to set attribute to.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_object ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attribute to contain the given attr_value, if possible.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_clear_status ()
refsect2.para: Clears the status information from info.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_file_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets a file's type (whether it is a regular file, symlink, etc). This is different from the file's content type, see g_file_info_get_content_type().

listitem.simpara: a GFileType for the given file.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_is_hidden ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a file is hidden.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the file is a hidden file, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_is_backup ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a file is a backup file.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if file is a backup file, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_is_symlink ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a file is a symlink.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the given info is a symlink.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the name for a file.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the file name.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_display_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets a display name for a file.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the display name.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_edit_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the edit name for a file.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the edit name.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_icon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the icon for a file.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_content_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the file's content type.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the file's content type.s

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_size ()
refsect2.para: Gets the file's size.

listitem.simpara: a goffset containing the file's size.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_modification_time ()
refsect2.para: Gets the modification time of the current info and sets it in result.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_symlink_target ()
refsect2.para: Gets the symlink target for a given GFileInfo.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the symlink target.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_etag ()
refsect2.para: Gets the entity tag for a given GFileInfo. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ETAG_VALUE.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the value of the "etag:value" attribute.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_get_sort_order ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of the sort_order attribute from the GFileInfo. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_SORT_ORDER.

listitem.simpara: a gint32 containing the value of the "standard::sort_order" attribute.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_attribute_mask ()
refsect2.para: Sets mask on info to match specific attribute types.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_unset_attribute_mask ()
refsect2.para: Unsets a mask set by g_file_info_set_attribute_mask(), if one is set.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_file_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the file type in a GFileInfo to type. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_TYPE.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_is_hidden ()
refsect2.para: Sets the "is_hidden" attribute in a GFileInfo according to is_symlink. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_IS_HIDDEN.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_is_symlink ()
refsect2.para: Sets the "is_symlink" attribute in a GFileInfo according to is_symlink. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_IS_SYMLINK.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the name attribute for the current GFileInfo. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_NAME.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_display_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the display name for the current GFileInfo. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_DISPLAY_NAME.

listitem.simpara: a string containing a display name.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_edit_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the edit name for the current file. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_EDIT_NAME.

listitem.simpara: a string containing an edit name.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_icon ()
refsect2.para: Sets the icon for a given GFileInfo. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_ICON.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_content_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the content type attribute for a given GFileInfo. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_CONTENT_TYPE.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_size ()
refsect2.para: Sets the G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_SIZE attribute in the file info to the given size.

listitem.simpara: a goffset containing the file's size.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_modification_time ()
refsect2.para: Sets the G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TIME_MODIFIED attribute in the file info to the given time value.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_symlink_target ()
refsect2.para: Sets the G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_SYMLINK_TARGET attribute in the file info to the given symlink target.

listitem.simpara: a static string containing a path to a symlink target.

refsect2.title: g_file_info_set_sort_order ()
refsect2.para: Sets the sort order attribute in the file info structure. See G_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_STANDARD_SORT_ORDER.

refsect2.title: g_file_attribute_matcher_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new file attribute matcher, which matches attributes against a given string. GFileAttributeMatchers are reference counted structures, and are created with a reference count of 1. If the number of references falls to 0, the GFileAttributeMatcher is automatically destroyed.

The attribute string should be formatted with specific keys separated from namespaces with a double colon. Several "namespace::key" strings may be concatenated with a single comma (e.g. "standard::type,standard::is-hidden"). The wildcard "*" may be used to match all keys and namespaces, or "namespace::*" will match all keys in a given namespace.

Examples of strings to use:
File Attribute Matcher strings and results
Matcher String Matches
"*"matches all attributes.
"standard::is-hidden"matches only the key is-hidden in the standard namespace.
"standard::type,unix::*"matches the type key in the standard namespace and all keys in the unix namespace.

refsect2.title: g_file_attribute_matcher_ref ()
refsect2.para: References a file attribute matcher.

refsect2.title: g_file_attribute_matcher_unref ()
refsect2.para: Unreferences matcher. If the reference count falls below 1, the matcher is automatically freed.

refsect2.title: g_file_attribute_matcher_matches ()
refsect2.para: Checks if an attribute will be matched by an attribute matcher. If the matcher was created with the "*" matching string, this function will always return TRUE.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if attribute matches matcher. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_attribute_matcher_matches_only ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a attribute matcher only matches a given attribute. Always returns FALSE if "*" was used when creating the matcher.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the matcher only matches attribute. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_attribute_matcher_enumerate_namespace ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the matcher will match all of the keys in a given namespace. This will always return TRUE if a wildcard character is in use (e.g. if matcher was created with "standard::*" and ns is "standard", or if matcher was created using "*" and namespace is anything.)
TODO: this is awkwardly worded.

listitem.simpara: a string containing a file attribute namespace.
TRUE if the matcher matches all of the entries in the given ns, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_file_attribute_matcher_enumerate_next ()
refsect2.para: Gets the next matched attribute from a GFileAttributeMatcher.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the next attribute or NULL if no more attribute exist.
